meanings.definition: To cause damage or harm to.
meanings.sent1: Accidentally dropping the fragile vase could endamage it.
meanings.sent2: The storm endamaged the roof of the house.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle eggs may endamage your kitchen floor!
meanings.sent4: His harsh words seemed to endamage her fragile emotions.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire quickly spread, threatening to endamage the entire forest.

meanings.sent1: The endamage to the car was extensive after the accident.
meanings.sent2: The endamage from the flood required significant repairs.
meanings.sent3: The endamage to his reputation was a result of his own actions.
meanings.sent4: The endamage to the environment was visible after the oil spill.
meanings.sent5: The endamage to the ancient artifact was irreversible.
